data.text: Blessed is the man that hath a virtuous wife,
A virtuous woman rejoiceth her husband,
A good wife is a good portion,
Whether a man be rich or poor, if he have a good heart toward the Lord,
There be three things that my heart feareth;
But a grief of heart and sorrow is a woman that is jealous over another woman,
An evil wife is a yoke shaken to and fro:
A drunken woman and a gadder abroad causeth great anger,
The whoredom of a woman may be known in her haughty looks and eyelids.
If thy daughter be shameless, keep her in straitly,
Watch over an impudent eye:
She will open her mouth, as a thirsty traveler when he hath found a fountain,
The grace of a wife delighteth her husband,
A silent and loving woman is a gift of the Lord;
A shamefaced and faithful woman is a double grace,
As the sun when it ariseth in the high heaven;
As the clear light is upon the holy candlestick:
As the golden pillars are upon the sockets of silver;
There be two things that grieve my heart;
A merchant shall hardly keep himself from doing wrong;
